project_descr: Human Security for Individuals and Communities in Chernobyl-Affected areas through local informational provision (ICRIN).

outputs.output_title: BRC ICRIN: Human Security in C
outputs.output_descr:
BRC ICRIN: Human Security in Chernobyl (regional). 
Human Security for Individuals and Communities in Chernobyl-Affected Areas through Local Information Provision (International Chernobyl Research and Information Network)

Regional ICRIN: Support for UN Chernobyl Coordination. In line with a shift in strategy from humanitarian assistance to development aid, UNDP assumed responsibility for UN-wide coordination of Chernobyl issues in 2004. This project aims to promote the recovery of communities affected by Chernobyl by 1) supporting the work of the Chernobyl Coordinator in efforts to mobilize resources, promote synergies in UNDP field work on Chernobyl, and build productive relationships with the Governments of the three most-affected countries; and 2) gaining visibility for UNDP’s role and key messages through p

outputs.output_title: UKR ICRIN: Human Security in C
outputs.output_descr:
Implementation of Chernobyl/ICRIN project Ukraine

The Chernobyl/ICRIN project will focus on meeting the priority information needs of the affected communities through the  introduction of a sustainable response mechanism that will link the information needs (in health, environment and socio-economic spheres) of Chernobyl-affected populations with corresponding internationally-recognized, objective scientific knowledge, adapted to be understandable to information consumers. Improved access to information will help people live safely and productively in the affected territories and enable the
